datafield.subfield: Verso of f98 and ruled blank leaves 99, 100, 101 are filled with Family Records of the de Gaules family for more than one generation. The first entry, at the top of the ruled blank leaf, recto, and records in French book hand the birth and baptism of "Gaspard mon premier fils," with date in French, the seventeenth of March: 1575: The second entry records the birth of a second son, Michel, in 1578; Francois, 1580; Francoise, 1582; Nicol, 1584; Florence(no date); Jacqueline, 1587; Nicole Laquelle, 1588; last entry, "Francoise ma fille." Lower margins of final 7 folio contain continued familial records in obscured cursive from 1615 to 1637, and the death of " Mousieur le consailer de gaulle" in 1638. There is a record of approxmately 22 entries from 1575 to 1588, then from 1615 to 1638. In the first family there were apparently 4 sons, 4 daughters; in the second family 11 sons, 3 daughters. Four sons, the earlier dying, are named Guillaume. Obtained from Retz and Storm, New York.
Item cataloged from existing description by C. Pierce and J. Fox, and in hand by Erika Milo and Ian Scott, July/August 2018.
All requests for permission to quote or publish from manuscripts must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections & University Archives.
Collation: 101 leaves in 13 quires of 8 (except 1¹², 2⁷, 8⁴, 13⁶). No catchwords, No signatures. Folio numbers in pencil. Much variety in emphatic rubrication.
Layout: One column of 18 lines upon a writing area of 100 x 57 mm.Visible ruling in light brown ink.
Script: In one hand of Gothic cursive called the French Batarde Script, notable is the lowercase "g," which is as a minuscule "y," with a horizontal bar extending through both ascending strokes.

Decoration: Larger 3-to-4 line initials in blue OR burgundy upon a gilded square with white floral tracery introducing chapters. Smaller 1-to-2 line gilt capitals upon blue and burgundy square are used to introduce sentences. In addition, five miniatures are found, and bordered with floral acanthus with accompanying pheasantry. Much variety in emphatic rubrication. Miniature illustrations: 1. (fol. 25r) The Annunciation (Hours of the Virgin, Matins). 2. (fol. 63r) The Crucifixion (Hours of the Cross). 3. (fol. 67r) The Pentecost (Hours of the Holy Spirit). 4. (fol. 70r) David at Prayer (Seven Penitential Psalms). 5. (fol. 85r) Funeral Scene (Office of the Dead).
Binding: Modern red morocco with marbled rose endpapers.
Shelfmark: Eugene, OR, Special Collections and University Archives, University of Oregon, MS 041.
Former shelfmark: Burgess Collection MS 19 (Bond & Faye).
As referenced by Jim Marrow Report: "Book of Hours with an Office of the Dead of Autun Use."

ff1r-12v Calendar -- ff13r-18r Gospel Extracts -- ff19r-24r Prayers to the Virgin -- ff25r-61v Hours of the Virgin -- ff63r-65r Hours of the Cross -- ff67r-69v Hours of the Holy Spirit -- ff70r-84v Penitential Psalms and Litany -- ff87r-97r Office of the Dead.
RESTRICTED ORIGINAL. USE DIGITAL COPY ONLY:
